teaching_goal: Introduce the concept of limits as a foundation for calculus.
Explain different ways to evaluate limits (graphically, numerically, algebraically).
Discuss the concept of continuity and its relationship with limits.

tasks: Discuss the importance of calculus and real-world applications.
Ask students: 'What do you think happens when we get infinitely close to a point on a function?'

topics.title: Introduction to Limits
concepts: Ways to evaluate limits: graphically, numerically, algebraically
examples: lim(x → a) f(x) = L means f(x) gets arbitrarily close to L as x approaches a.

topics.title: Continuity and Limits
concepts: Types of discontinuities: removable, jump, and infinite

problems.question:
Determine whether the function is continuous at x = 1:
 f(x) = { x + 2, x < 1; 3, x = 1; x^2, x > 1 }

summary: Recap key points: limits, evaluation methods, continuity conditions.
homework: Determine whether f(x) = |x - 3| / (x - 3) is continuous at x = 3.
